question.question_text: Which ONE of the following is object oriented programming
Which of the following is not a Java features?
The default value of a static integer variable of a class in Java is,

question.option_A: more classes inheriting from one super class
question.option_B: one class inheriting from more super classes
question.option_C: more classes inheriting from more super classes

question.question_text: To prevent any method from overriding, we declare the method as,
The fields in an interface are implicitly specified as,
Which of the following is not true?
question.option_A: An interface can extend another interface.
question.option_B: A class which is implementing an interface must implement all the methods of the interface.
question.option_C: An interface can implement another interface.
question.option_D: An interface is a solution for multiple inheritance in java.

question.question_text: In a class definition, the special method provided to be called to create an instance of that class is known as a/an

question.option_A: The same method name with different types of parameters
question.option_B: The same method name with different number of parameters
question.option_C: The same method name and same number and type of parameters with different return type
